intro: Dyschoriste oblongifolia var. angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
